###

###

###

###

###

<span key="e13b4f62a42a45ad91163b2f3dabb361"><span offset-key="e13b4f62a42a45ad91163b2f3dabb361:0">We have seen </span>`cd`<span offset-key="e13b4f62a42a45ad91163b2f3dabb361:2"> command to change directory but if we want to move back or want to move to the parent directory we can use a special symbol </span>`..`<span offset-key="e13b4f62a42a45ad91163b2f3dabb361:4"> after </span>`cd`<span offset-key="e13b4f62a42a45ad91163b2f3dabb361:6"> command, like </span>`cd ..`</span>

### 

<span key="4493e054844c453887ab372386bf0e13"><span offset-key="4493e054844c453887ab372386bf0e13:0">âœ” Create Files âž¡ </span>`touch`<span offset-key="4493e054844c453887ab372386bf0e13:2">:</span></span>

<span key="6d0f9464a10e44bc80195733708c2521"><span offset-key="6d0f9464a10e44bc80195733708c2521:0">We can create an empty file by typing </span>`touch file_name`<span offset-key="6d0f9464a10e44bc80195733708c2521:2">. It's going to create a new file in the current directory (the directory you are currently in) with your provided name.</span></span>

<span key="2193362f6de345299ad2dced313ab230"><span offset-key="2193362f6de345299ad2dced313ab230:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="82c3d9082470440b92778c44128677ba"></span>

<span key="76cb6baece464353b0de7b3e24bb1b5e"><span offset-key="76cb6baece464353b0de7b3e24bb1b5e:0">I created a hello.txt file in my current working directory. Again you can use \`ls\` command to see the file is created or not.</span></span>

<span key="0da08b9aa43f4458b4867441fa3a289c"><span offset-key="0da08b9aa43f4458b4867441fa3a289c:0">Now open your hello.txt file in your text editor and write </span>*Hello Everyone!*<span offset-key="0da08b9aa43f4458b4867441fa3a289c:2"> into your hello.txt file and save it.</span></span>

### 

<span key="97b5e4fd2f464088afac09abe1b211fe"><span offset-key="97b5e4fd2f464088afac09abe1b211fe:0">âœ” Display the Content of a File âž¡ </span>`cat`<span offset-key="97b5e4fd2f464088afac09abe1b211fe:2">:</span></span>

<span key="6ec69902b73a4e43a106a92ec0e03cf4"><span offset-key="6ec69902b73a4e43a106a92ec0e03cf4:0">We can display the content of a file using the </span>`cat`<span offset-key="6ec69902b73a4e43a106a92ec0e03cf4:2"> command. To use it type </span>`cat file_name`<span offset-key="6ec69902b73a4e43a106a92ec0e03cf4:4">.</span></span>

<span key="6129ddf556464b7d8b4202371c48ceac"><span offset-key="6129ddf556464b7d8b4202371c48ceac:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="a7f40cce39744dca87fa05f5fc1fbbf1"></span>

<span key="ab7ca54e93ca4399b2e218dbae23b3d5"><span offset-key="ab7ca54e93ca4399b2e218dbae23b3d5:0">Shows the content of my hello.txt file.</span></span>

### 

<span key="29c86c5b9b184e0e939d8c24aec9c890"><span offset-key="29c86c5b9b184e0e939d8c24aec9c890:0">âœ” Move Files & Directories âž¡ </span>`mv`<span offset-key="29c86c5b9b184e0e939d8c24aec9c890:2">:</span></span>

<span key="7dc32d8236c140b88d9efcd84b5b3ecb"><span offset-key="7dc32d8236c140b88d9efcd84b5b3ecb:0">To move a file and directory, we use </span>`mv`<span offset-key="7dc32d8236c140b88d9efcd84b5b3ecb:2"> command.</span></span>

<span key="29c1d6a0b7424a64a8c2b959aea714ab"><span offset-key="29c1d6a0b7424a64a8c2b959aea714ab:0">By typing </span>`mv file_to_move                                         destination_directory`<span offset-key="29c1d6a0b7424a64a8c2b959aea714ab:2">, you can move a file to the specified directory.</span></span>

<span key="eefa3739456f49bf8f9161954cd23492"><span offset-key="eefa3739456f49bf8f9161954cd23492:0">By entering </span>`mv directory_to_move                                         destination_directory`<span offset-key="eefa3739456f49bf8f9161954cd23492:2">, you can move all the files and directories under that directory.</span></span>

<span key="8c9ffb4ff18346b2a4025143eaa042db"><span offset-key="8c9ffb4ff18346b2a4025143eaa042db:0">Before using this command, we are going to create two more directories and another txt file in our cli-practice directory.</span></span>

<span key="ddbb3e5adf3147e5a9dc71cc2fa65e85">`mkdir html css touch bye.txt`</span>

<span key="277005ae46594cb8b4f7eadbe007d51c"><span offset-key="277005ae46594cb8b4f7eadbe007d51c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="95a1be7d15c74e2784a2a5617876d25b"></span>

<span key="a0145e07c66f47b5a09396ec4ce2a8d5"><span offset-key="a0145e07c66f47b5a09396ec4ce2a8d5:0">Yes, we can use multiple directories & files names one after another to create multiple directories & files in one command.</span></span><span slate-void="true" key="253f6bc79a5344dfaa32aad12f88345d"></span>

<span key="56a43799b2f949a981b7fda1d72f1d4c"><span offset-key="56a43799b2f949a981b7fda1d72f1d4c:0">Moved my bye.txt file into my css directory and then moved my css directory into my html directory.</span></span>

### 

<span key="c4999d9402e7469f96be306e92e814e1"><span offset-key="c4999d9402e7469f96be306e92e814e1:0">âœ” Rename Files & Directories âž¡ </span>`mv`<span offset-key="c4999d9402e7469f96be306e92e814e1:2">:</span></span>

<span key="abbac65c3f8d42ee9475fbe6fa416e55">`mv`<span offset-key="abbac65c3f8d42ee9475fbe6fa416e55:1"> command can also be used to rename a file and a directory.</span></span>

<span key="cddbe1fb56af4666a73c16eb0fd63043"><span offset-key="cddbe1fb56af4666a73c16eb0fd63043:0">You can rename a file by typing </span>`mv old_file_name new_file_name`<span offset-key="cddbe1fb56af4666a73c16eb0fd63043:2"> & also rename a directory by typing </span>`mv old_directory_name                                         new_directory_name`<span offset-key="cddbe1fb56af4666a73c16eb0fd63043:4">.</span></span>

<span key="1d9c288a8e8b4deb84c77bb238f3d22f"><span offset-key="1d9c288a8e8b4deb84c77bb238f3d22f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="ea2978c24f624ef7b6a9d1b855f00500"></span>

<span key="f6d9747006ac4f9cae8949b666e62bd7"><span offset-key="f6d9747006ac4f9cae8949b666e62bd7:0">Renamed my hello.txt file to the hi.txt file and html directory to the folder directory.</span></span>

### 

<span key="edce6de8c579402a9901af4734370604"><span offset-key="edce6de8c579402a9901af4734370604:0">âœ” Copy Files & Directories âž¡ </span>`cp`<span offset-key="edce6de8c579402a9901af4734370604:2">:</span></span>

<span key="096ca3d3933745ebaa230c01a661ab8d"><span offset-key="096ca3d3933745ebaa230c01a661ab8d:0">To do this, we use the </span>`cp`<span offset-key="096ca3d3933745ebaa230c01a661ab8d:2"> command.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="3228756336d941d08b9476641f5ef9d3"><span offset-key="3228756336d941d08b9476641f5ef9d3:0">You can copy a file by entering </span>`cp file_to_copy                                                 new_file_name`<span offset-key="3228756336d941d08b9476641f5ef9d3:2">.</span></span>

<span key="f9d7f7b8b7234aeaa59680830b6a2133"><span offset-key="f9d7f7b8b7234aeaa59680830b6a2133:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="0323bbefafc9470ead5204a2d7c6cbf5"></span>

<span key="73e57aeca62345f7bacd2b839ded0430"><span offset-key="73e57aeca62345f7bacd2b839ded0430:0">Copied my hi.txt file content into hello.txt file. For confirmation open your hello.txt file in your text editor.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4e58e71985434e6d92ff5d350fdcbe69"><span offset-key="4e58e71985434e6d92ff5d350fdcbe69:0">You can also copy a directory by adding the </span>`-r`<span offset-key="4e58e71985434e6d92ff5d350fdcbe69:2"> option, like </span>`cp -r directory_to_copy                                                 new_directory_name`<span offset-key="4e58e71985434e6d92ff5d350fdcbe69:4">.</span></span>

<span key="c0ed887855d741b480b2514e6fdaa455">*The*<span offset-key="c0ed887855d741b480b2514e6fdaa455:1"> </span>`-r`<span offset-key="c0ed887855d741b480b2514e6fdaa455:3"> </span>*option for "recursive" means that it will copy all of the files including the files inside of subfolders.*</span>

<span key="3f4b390ac1dc43b582ff4d5f87e93e1e"><span offset-key="3f4b390ac1dc43b582ff4d5f87e93e1e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="a400d71e3b4f4aa58b678aec6d46dc07"></span>

<span key="fb9444d97ce54d3c92d18ad903e2d672"><span offset-key="fb9444d97ce54d3c92d18ad903e2d672:0">Here I copied all of the files from the folder to folder-copy.</span></span>

### 

<span key="c6ab44d1f8fc4e9eaeb7bfb6048cc01f"><span offset-key="c6ab44d1f8fc4e9eaeb7bfb6048cc01f:0">âœ” Remove Files & Directories âž¡ </span>`rm`<span offset-key="c6ab44d1f8fc4e9eaeb7bfb6048cc01f:2">:</span></span>

<span key="b72e997d9d164b33a07f53ff6272df42"><span offset-key="b72e997d9d164b33a07f53ff6272df42:0">To do this, we use the </span>`rm`<span offset-key="b72e997d9d164b33a07f53ff6272df42:2"> command.</span></span>

    <span key="cc511ebdb40842548c8deb1c9c7901b7"><span offset-key="cc511ebdb40842548c8deb1c9c7901b7:0">To remove a file, you can use the command like </span>`rm file_to_remove`<span offset-key="cc511ebdb40842548c8deb1c9c7901b7:2">.</span></span>

<span key="526fc5cb2ecc4f52bfedd1810c36cdaf"><span offset-key="526fc5cb2ecc4f52bfedd1810c36cdaf:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="7a10a8c756684558b3a4939bbe5347bf"></span>

<span key="0f90a2017cf546c78e54c20af073f5b4"><span offset-key="0f90a2017cf546c78e54c20af073f5b4:0">Here I removed my hi.txt file.</span></span>

    <span key="32e78e4a774741fd96528e2a181978c1"><span offset-key="32e78e4a774741fd96528e2a181978c1:0">To remove a directory, use the command like </span>`rm -r directory_to_remove`<span offset-key="32e78e4a774741fd96528e2a181978c1:2">.</span></span>

<span key="f2e2234dbbbf482eaa277f8fe3b5d537"><span offset-key="f2e2234dbbbf482eaa277f8fe3b5d537:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="c692cfb378f24f67ad0c90d007afe998"></span>

### 

<span key="15e3f74a6b17489f8a69b11decee6568"><span offset-key="15e3f74a6b17489f8a69b11decee6568:0">âœ” Clear Screen âž¡ </span>`clear`<span offset-key="15e3f74a6b17489f8a69b11decee6568:2">:</span></span>

<span key="bbdf10a119774cdab7a963c41912c5d2"><span offset-key="bbdf10a119774cdab7a963c41912c5d2:0">Clear command is used to clear the terminal screen.</span></span>

### 

<span key="1bddd54a8feb4d5e837a392b960fbe93"><span offset-key="1bddd54a8feb4d5e837a392b960fbe93:0">âœ” Home Directory âž¡ </span>`~`<span offset-key="1bddd54a8feb4d5e837a392b960fbe93:2">:</span></span>

<span key="d7ac44b8ddab470888056116696c23bb"><span offset-key="d7ac44b8ddab470888056116696c23bb:0">The Home directory is represented by </span>`~`<span offset-key="d7ac44b8ddab470888056116696c23bb:2">. The Home directory refers to the base directory for the user. If we want to move to the Home directory we can use </span>`cd ~`<span offset-key="d7ac44b8ddab470888056116696c23bb:4"> command. Or we can only use </span>`cd`<span offset-key="d7ac44b8ddab470888056116696c23bb:6"> command.</span></span>

<span key="bad50e6ee8fe473982ad3ba5b776ad43"><span offset-key="bad50e6ee8fe473982ad3ba5b776ad43:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="1cb5065b3bad461f9c9e4ac6533a7b99"><span offset-key="1cb5065b3bad461f9c9e4ac6533a7b99:0">1.) Recursively unzip zip files and then delete the archives when finished:</span></span>

<span key="aa6583c532c544bb99406080a5725cc5">**here is a**<span offset-key="aa6583c532c544bb99406080a5725cc5:1"> </span></span><a href="https://github.com/bgoonz/bash-commands-walkthrough/tree/master/steps/1-recursive-unzip" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d7f2a6006df843ae89177646b442cfd5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-1709_259-1710-237__"><span data-key="e31ab04ab2854fc4a868ed8ab32e9599"><strong>folde</strong></span></span></a><span key="4cbb9840ef5846d2a1d1e540b149852b">**r containing the before and afterâ€¦ I had to change folder names slightly due to a limit on the length of file-paths in a github repo.**</span>

1

<span key="a76db3a9cb554c719a4fdff729030cae"><span offset-key="a76db3a9cb554c719a4fdff729030cae:0">find . -name "\*.zip" | while read filename; do unzip -o -d "\`dirname "$filename"\`" "$filename"; done; </span></span>

2

<span key="0868c9ad20414362a22ab6e49d4a76f7"><span offset-key="0868c9ad20414362a22ab6e49d4a76f7:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

3

<span key="59f83720aaf34a148702357ac04956eb"><span offset-key="59f83720aaf34a148702357ac04956eb:0">find . -name "\*.zip" -type f -print -delete</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="2087df234cea4cf1a33ec366d9b66292"><span offset-key="2087df234cea4cf1a33ec366d9b66292:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="6dde006bebd942b4ae971a2ed4dfb07d"><span offset-key="6dde006bebd942b4ae971a2ed4dfb07d:0">3.) Clean up unnecessary files/folders in git repo:</span></span>

1

<span key="bb9d0d9cd05b42bea115948f1ef1cbc7"><span offset-key="bb9d0d9cd05b42bea115948f1ef1cbc7:0">find . -empty -type f -print -delete #Remove empty files</span></span>

2

<span key="49855353bd464e3888709ab1630743a5"><span offset-key="49855353bd464e3888709ab1630743a5:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

3

<span key="02596c123ffa432091d07af5647a26a3"><span offset-key="02596c123ffa432091d07af5647a26a3:0"># -------------------------------------------------------</span></span>

4

<span key="9fc156be6c3a49c69cce1247dab21578"><span offset-key="9fc156be6c3a49c69cce1247dab21578:0">find . -empty -type d -print -delete #Remove empty folders</span></span>

5

<span key="6a3769c5f72d479e84ba2e00c6916115"><span offset-key="6a3769c5f72d479e84ba2e00c6916115:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

6

<span key="ad9ae2e19703491585b2d40dbe274812"><span offset-key="ad9ae2e19703491585b2d40dbe274812:0"># -------------------------------------------------------</span></span>

7

<span key="b61452652327447aa89b0a851205e8c7"><span offset-key="b61452652327447aa89b0a851205e8c7:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

8

<span key="9d5b9aa1ad4646ff8918d759ab427f67"><span offset-key="9d5b9aa1ad4646ff8918d759ab427f67:0"># This will remove .git folders... .gitmodule files as well as .gitattributes and .gitignore files. </span></span>

9

<span key="c3065bb8dde34a53b331af3e7a3e1f63"><span offset-key="c3065bb8dde34a53b331af3e7a3e1f63:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

10

<span key="ffd8fdca83af4f6eb50473d64b33da55"><span offset-key="ffd8fdca83af4f6eb50473d64b33da55:0">find . \\( -name ".git" -o -name ".gitignore" -o -name ".gitmodules" -o -name ".gitattributes" \\) -exec rm -rf -- {} + </span></span>

11

<span key="8f475e340fe94c00aec68031e1a971a2"><span offset-key="8f475e340fe94c00aec68031e1a971a2:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

12

<span key="6265ff79347c4b309147384355d6a657"><span offset-key="6265ff79347c4b309147384355d6a657:0"># -------------------------------------------------------</span></span>

13

<span key="9f84b7d6dab64fd1b8ec6887ed6711f0"><span offset-key="9f84b7d6dab64fd1b8ec6887ed6711f0:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

14

<span key="782de7146e32470a8033f9211371ae05"><span offset-key="782de7146e32470a8033f9211371ae05:0"># This will remove the filenames you see listed below that just take up space if a repo has been downloaded for use exclusively in your personal file system (in which case the following files just take up space)# Disclaimer... you should not use this command in a repo that you intend to use with your work as it removes files that attribute the work to their original creators!</span></span>

15

<span key="9bb114ae1d8442f087c783a5889301a8"><span offset-key="9bb114ae1d8442f087c783a5889301a8:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

16

<span key="d669ec0352c14d259403cee2507ccd6f"><span offset-key="d669ec0352c14d259403cee2507ccd6f:0">find . \\( -name "\*SECURITY.txt" -o -name "\*RELEASE.txt" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.txt" -o -name "\*LICENSE.txt" -o -name "\*CONTRIBUTING.txt" -name "\*HISTORY.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE" -o -name "\*SECURITY.md" -o -name "\*RELEASE.md" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE.md" -o -name "\*CODE\_OF\_CONDUCT.md" -o -name "\\\*CONTRIBUTING.md" \\) -exec rm -rf -- {} +</span></span>

### 

<span key="1a97c3be72fb476aab5195f3cd2c3b08"><span offset-key="1a97c3be72fb476aab5195f3cd2c3b08:0">In Action:</span></span>

## 

<span key="5aeb9c5a295c4fc3958236880eb5699d"><span offset-key="5aeb9c5a295c4fc3958236880eb5699d:0">!!!Use with caution as this command removes the attribution of the work from itâ€™s original authors!!!!!</span></span>

<span key="219f058c858f4615b899032a1cd39135"><span offset-key="219f058c858f4615b899032a1cd39135:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><span slate-void="true" key="90ed8efcc81a4b04b05403aa33bd0c70"></span>

<span key="bb70b22933734363b4e13b38d3aa105e"><span offset-key="bb70b22933734363b4e13b38d3aa105e:0">!!!Use with caution as this command removes the attribution of the work from itâ€™s original authors!!!!!find . \\( -name "\*SECURITY.txt" -o -name "\*RELEASE.txt" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.txt" -o -name "\*LICENSE.txt" -o -name "\*CONTRIBUTING.txt" -name "\*HISTORY.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE" -o -name "\*SECURITY.md" -o -name "\*RELEASE.md" -o -name "\*CHANGELOG.md" -o -name "\*LICENSE.md" -o -name "\*CODE\_OF\_CONDUCT.md" -o -name "\*CONTRIBUTING.md" \\) -exec rm -rf -- {} +</span></span>

<span key="334c618be33b4325aa2a0e2448c90db1"><span offset-key="334c618be33b4325aa2a0e2448c90db1:0"> mv "$f" "$f.html"</span></span>

3

<span key="b5b18d6519364ea6aed9c6d8ed8d6c50"><span offset-key="b5b18d6519364ea6aed9c6d8ed8d6c50:0">doneecho "&lt;form></span></span>

4

<span key="403bd6448ae0452391eb46e59f878f78"><span offset-key="403bd6448ae0452391eb46e59f878f78:0"> &lt;input type="button" value="Go back!" onclick="history.back()"></span></span>

5

<span key="d1a619ffc6d94a449391e79afa35fba5"><span offset-key="d1a619ffc6d94a449391e79afa35fba5:0">&lt;/form></span></span>

6

<span key="2d5f119129a34c728a070c98b5d76954"><span offset-key="2d5f119129a34c728a070c98b5d76954:0"> &lt;/body>&lt;/html>" | tee -a \*.html</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="4a3499136d5d4008bbd0d37ecd73a802"><span offset-key="4a3499136d5d4008bbd0d37ecd73a802:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="381e571b9a3c4c1395949862934b43b2"><span offset-key="381e571b9a3c4c1395949862934b43b2:0">14. Batch Download Videos</span></span>

1

<span key="4d95b7cc87e34b1687c1db5f1a1a9a8b"><span offset-key="4d95b7cc87e34b1687c1db5f1a1a9a8b:0">#!/bin/bash</span></span>

<span key="6bfefdd320be4528ac709c9c70f1620d"><span offset-key="6bfefdd320be4528ac709c9c70f1620d:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

3

<span key="fc08a2588ae143f89590b37bdf684ac0"><span offset-key="fc08a2588ae143f89590b37bdf684ac0:0">link="#insert url here#"</span></span>

<span key="fb665ec4f1c2482fa7d6aafee6a2fbcb"><span offset-key="fb665ec4f1c2482fa7d6aafee6a2fbcb:0">#links were a set of strings with just the index of the video as the variable</span></span>

5

<span key="80dd89936c7449bd930c0653bd255623"><span offset-key="80dd89936c7449bd930c0653bd255623:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

6

<span key="a8098af7d3594b7390d3e0c75049888e"><span offset-key="a8098af7d3594b7390d3e0c75049888e:0">num=3</span></span>

7

<span key="50851779dde640149de911897e13e6f4"><span offset-key="50851779dde640149de911897e13e6f4:0">#first video was numbered 3 - weird.</span></span>

8

<span key="81fb207bb99c486d903444f1a78eb25a"><span offset-key="81fb207bb99c486d903444f1a78eb25a:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

9

<span key="5e0da67486f540499488c14fb8c3c87a"><span offset-key="5e0da67486f540499488c14fb8c3c87a:0">ext=".mp4"</span></span>

10

<span key="4dc6714dd9e148e5ab52ee28390445f3"><span offset-key="4dc6714dd9e148e5ab52ee28390445f3:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">â€‹</span></span></span>

11

<span key="b42221ba51424c9dae6cdb00c363ee45"><span offset-key="b42221ba51424c9dae6cdb00c363ee45:0">while \[ $num -le 66 \]</span></span>

12

<span key="841d7d69849b4b0fa89abb14e2db1678"><span offset-key="841d7d69849b4b0fa89abb14e2db1678:0">do</span></span>

13

<span key="c783812ae045461eb30c63702e574e08"><span offset-key="c783812ae045461eb30c63702e574e08:0"> wget $link$num$ext -P ~/Downloads/</span></span>

14

<span key="44714588ef4c45bbb4eeff3ba35cb37c"><span offset-key="44714588ef4c45bbb4eeff3ba35cb37c:0"> num=$(($num+1))</span></span>

1
